title: PCC Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Kent, OH) in Jul 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interesante interesante revisar. No no no no......esta muy bueno en inglés. Por por por por favor. No hablaré mas. No 😔 🚱 🚭 🙅‍♂️ ⛔️ no es que sea un buen día
Interview Questions: Experiencia es mucho interesante según

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial Zoom interview with the staff, followed by a final interview with the PI. Overall it was a pretty quick turn-around and not too difficult of an interview.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a time you had a difficult situation in your last position and how you resolved it?

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Onsite interview across both campuses. Very dependent on where your program is. This was for the neuroscience PhD program. Your mileage may vary. One on one interviews across two days to show how you might be placed into a variety of different lab and research environments.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: It was not too long and they really just wanted to try to get to know you for who you are. They seemed like they were really interested in what you had to say and the most important part was that you had to effectively communicate that you were interested in what you were doing.
Interview Questions: Why are you passionate about the subject

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Everyone was very kind and the interview went well. We had a video interview first and a zoom interview for the second round. Spoke to the floor manager and a few other employees on the floor.
Interview Questions: Please walk us through your resume

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was professional, nice, able to answer all of my questions. However, the salary range listed online was not the same as the salary quoted during the interview. There seemed to be a miscommunication between the person who posted the job and the interview.
Interview Questions: What specific experience do you have?

title: HR Call Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Two video interviews conducted including the hiring manager as well as the department director. The questions were two the point and they were very flexible and understanding with requests made upon hiring.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had a challenge at work and how you responded.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Mostly conducted via email and it was straightforward. Was tailored to candidates and did not seem standardized. Questions were fair and related to the position. Found it within a week.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work with them.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: There is a committee that will interview you. A staff member will coordinate a time for the interview to take place. The interview took place via Zoom. There was an opportunity to ask questions. It felt a little overwhelming since committee members take turns asking questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: pretty basic questions with some how would you handle certain situations. interviewers were very nice. asked about familiarity with certain research terms, HIV (lab worked with hiv patients), comfort in dealing with certain types of people and certain tasks
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with consent in a research study?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by an 8 hour on campus interview. Interview has multiple parts, including sessions over meals. This interview process did not require a presentation. Lots of time with fellow staff, but not enough time with the hiring manager (Director).
Interview Questions: If not in the event field, what career would I have chosen?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward; initial screening interview with HR director, followed by three interviews with project leads, staff and a final conversation with the center director. Conversations focused on suitability for/interest in the center’s projects and fit with the work culture.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Two thirty minute interview phone calls very polite and overall enjoyed the conversations that were had. Expect standard interview questions and be prepared to ask questions about the culture and the role of the company
Interview Questions: How would your coworkers describe you

title: Patient Liaison Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Good and fair. Explained role at the facility. Explained the responsibilities at the facility. Showed us around the taco table and where you would be working. Was meeting with a few leaders at the facility. I
Interview Questions: Past experience that I have at other positions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds. The first is with the general committe members. The second is with the PI that you are specially interested in or they are interested in you. After the two interviews, they will meet and rate you based on your scores and knowledge and experience.
Interview Questions: Please descibe in details your innovative works in your previous research experience.

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: 3 separate virtual interviews with two managers and one principle investigator. Very friendly and welcoming environment. The whole process took less than three weeks. Received offer and was able to negotiate salary.
Interview Questions: Why NU? Experience with clinical research? What's your career goal?

title: Communication Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Virginia Beach, VA)
Interview Descriptions: Easy and straight. It wasn’t long too. About an hour or so it was very informative. Also, could have been shorter if anything 579323f45f2549001a9075b98fe3438f This is a reminder your appointment for Video Interview is on Thursday, October 27, 2022 3:00pm ACCEPT CALENDAR INVITE TO CONFIRM INTERVIEW: Once
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when…

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: They put a lot of emphasis on what you did in undergrad such an internships and the jobs you had during that time. They want you to go into detail about everything
Interview Questions: Describe a time you worked in a team?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at Northwestern Law School's Center for Wrongful Convictions was informal and conversational. They asked about my resume and why I was interested in interning for the summer.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at the Center for Wrongful Convictions?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
It was a 3 steps interview:
1. brief discussion: ~30m
2. Detailed presentation of research followed by a Q and A session: ~2hr
3. one-to-one meeting with lab members: 15min/per person
Interview Questions:
Q. Most questions were about my research and how I will apply those knowledge to the new projects?
Q. Where do I want to see myself in 10 years?

title: General Applications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I was referred to a recruiter by a friend. The recruiter and I set up a phone call to talk right away. I had an interest in one particular role although the recruiter had 3 roles for my consideration.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your interests? What sort of role are you looking for?

title: Associate Director of Prospect Management & Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fir there is a phone interview with a recruiter, phone interview with director of department and then zoom interviews with at least 4 different groups/departments that the employee will be working with.
Interview Questions: Please describe your goals while in this role.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
There were four people in the hiring committee. 
All of them were very polite and friendly. 
They made me feel confident.  I had other interviews with like seven people and they seemed tired. This interview was different. 
I don't remember every detail
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and personable. The manager was able to answer any questions I may have had and describe the job  more in depth. After my interview, I did not hear back from them for 2 weeks but then got an offer (as the manager was on vacation)
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Senior Director Digital Strategy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Invited for four (4) rounds of interviews over the course of multiple weeks. Pay range was on low-side for desired skills, but I continued interviewing because I was interested in exploring higher-ed instead of consumer marketing. After the four rounds of interviews, I was ghosted and heard nothing further from recruiter or anyone on hiring team. Please value candidate time as much as your own time.
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Research Engineer II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Initial email exchange, followed by an in-person interview with the prospective employer. Following the interview, we had a phone call follow up to discuss any other questions, and the job offer.
Interview Questions: research background, research interests, what could I add to the lab

title: Newsroom Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: A thorough interview process to understand the role and expectations, and they encouraged questions and ways to  accommodate the role and responsibilities to include my interests. It was a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Do you have any prior experience with using media monitoring sites?

title: Industrial Hygienist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two-part interview process; first was a sit down with direct supervisor.  Second was a panel interview. Both weren't that bad, just a general description of the task as well as some scenario based questions
Interview Questions: Name a time when you disagreed with someone in the field, how did you correct it?; Name a time when you failed, and how did you deal with it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Not difficult, they are looking for enthusiasm for research in the given field. Express your interests and explain why you are a good fit for the position. If you have any background in research, express that.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a research assistant?

title: Associate Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview, 2 hour long Zoom panel with 4 different people at Northwestern. All 4 had similar questions on my working style, how I handle conflict etc. overall, it was not too bad!
Interview Questions: How do I deal with conflict

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: 5 seperate teams interviews that were with members of the prospective departmental team. These interviews were spanned throughout the entire day. Three of five interviewers clearly distracted and not participating - all reitorating the same briefing of the position that was previously said.  Overall, was not asked a single question about my experience, no clarification questions on my CV, no opportunity to expand.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Clinical Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Basic in-person interview and assessment interview on the same day with clinical trials manager, easy, 1 hour, reviewed job role and responsibilities, and talked about life goals. Two interview processes.
Interview Questions: What is my 5 year plan

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process varies depending on department. It’s typically about 4-5 hours with breaks in between meeting with groups of direct colleagues and campus partners . I interviewed during COVID and the interview was on Zoom. The division is still interviewing via Zoom as of late 2022. Be prepared to conduct a presentation, showcase your skills via writing samples, and get ready for some scenario based questions. Overall, I found the process very similar to other campuses.
Interview Questions: Tell us about trends you’re following in the field of Student Affairs and/or residence life. Tell us about a student crisis situation you’ve responded to. Who was involved? How did you prioritize in the situation? What was the end result?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (San Antonio, TX) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people. The hiring lady was so kind and very positive. She was down to earth and asked me if I had any questions about the position. She offered to have me interview with the panel later that day which I agreed to.
Interview Questions: How would I contribute to the university

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager contacted me to set up the interview. The first round of interview  was with the manager for a phone screen. The second round is with the PIs. Well organized.
Interview Questions: typical questions, eg. why are you interested in this position

title: Developer Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I received a message scheduling a time for an interview. I was waiting 10 minutes for the person to call me on the scheduled time. When it was 10 minutes after, I sent an email saying to cancel my application. The recruitment process is a window into the company, and I can't work at a place that doesn't respect my time. There was no notification that they would be late, or an attempt to reschedule ahead of time. I was left in the dark. Soon after it seems they attempted to call me but it was too late at that point.
Interview Questions: no interview questions were asked because no interview was conducted.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Very simple and basic questions that were related to prior job experiences and current job experiences. They wanted to know if i was comfortable around blood and human tissues. also wanted to know if i was comfortable working extra hours.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness?

title: Pre-PA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was completely online and was a recorded interview through . I found it jarring and hard to complete and believe I would have interviewed better were it with a real interviewer.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses I believe

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic behavioral questions. I felt like I answered the questions the best I could. After I gave my answer, the interviewer said good job. As expected, I got my offer.
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Great interview , they make you feel like family. Tell you about the program culture. Ask you about what your passionate about. This all allows you to have a great benefit in knowing what type of culture the program has.
Interview Questions: what about northwestern attract you ?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
Easy Interview. Three step process, I met with the recruiter,  the administrative manager, and the director.

Typical interview questions

Tell me about yourself?...

Describe a difficult situation...

When can you start?..

Typical interview questions

Tell me about yourself?...

Describe a difficult situation...

When can you start?..
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 

What experience do you have?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous application process, but nice on-campus visit. I really enjoyed getting to talk with faculty and staff and students and others. They were all professional and informative. I was very impressed.
Interview Questions: Why did you pick Northwestern?

title: Assistant Financial Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions:
1st-zoom meeting, getting familiar with one another. Basic questions 
2nd- in person interview with the people of the department 
3-interview with HR

Easily the worst waste of time I’ve ever been through. 3 rounds of interviews to get an email months later telling me I didn’t get the job. Horrible horrible horrible! Please don’t even bother interviewing.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy with general questions. They will ask mainly the basic interview questions. You will have at least 2 interviews. One with HR and the managers. They also will let you meet other employees and show you around.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself

title: Research Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The manager will reach out you via email to confirm your interest  and schedule a 30min video interview. There are two members of team will talk to you. The team members are really nice.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and your project experience. Some technical questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Was smooth and efficient. Good questions and realistic timeline. No long drawn out questions but questions were good in making me think on the spot of things that I maybe did not think of before hand.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a challenge you faced at work and how you handled it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was very relaxed! The hiring manager asked a lot of general questions regarding my skill set and past experiences. Be prepared to describe why you are interested in the job.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Teaching Assistant for CTD Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Scheduled interview. Zoom interview with behavior questions and situational examples. Talked about scheduling and availability as well as possible classes and responsibilities. Pretty casual and lasted around 30 minutes. Received offer about 2 weeks afterward.
Interview Questions: How would you utilize online learning tools?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was very rushed, took place over Zoom, and I received an offer the next day. I met with two people, and it seemed like they were desperate to get someone with experience into the role. They all but offered me the job during the interview but were really vague about what the position would actually involve.
Interview Questions: Honestly, I cannot even remember specific questions. It was more "tell us about yourself" and I talked about my relevant experience from there. It was not a typical interview with HR-style questions, more of a conversation.

title: Research Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial call and then an in person interview. In which I met with 3 people. It was a easy process. I enjoyed the process.  I got to see the office
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that meets this position ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were casual, on zoom, as they are wont to be nowadays. The first interview was with one person, then a second interview with a whole team. They asked general interview questions and also specific scenario questions based on the department.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who missed the cut-off deadline and was upset that you couldn't fix the problem for them?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rigorous but the interviewers truly worked to connect and put me at ease. It was hard to tell whether or not I was doing well as I was interviewing, but they did respond to my answers which meant they were listening intently.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenge you've faced and how you overcame it?

title: Library Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Email questionnaire ; 30min 1st round interview ; 2 hour long group Zoom interview.   Final round was given option to be on site or Zoom.   Everything else was via email, phone, or online.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and meaningful interview process. I met about 6 people on the team over the course of several hours to get a sense of their work and culture. Welcoming and driven group.
Interview Questions: Asked about commitment to local public health and evaluation

title: Law School Applicant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Very concise and straightforward. The last two questions are always the same. Less nervous because you are talking to your computer instead of a living and breathing AO. Be fully prepared and you can nail this.
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern? What do you want to say to the admission officers that is not included in your resume?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Internal hire - relatively informal interview process. Consisted of an interview with two members of a committee and an interview with the program director. All interviews were behavioral. There was no case interviewing.
Interview Questions: What do people believe about you that isn't true?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Geneva, IL) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Scheduling was flexible and the manger was way to talk to. It moved along quickly between interview, shadowing experience and getting an offer. They were also very flexible with start date. The
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Friendly Interviewer, Clear, Great questions. Engaging. First interview was brief, interviewer took the time out to explain everything and was very professional.Friendly Interviewer, Clear, Great questions. Engaging. First interview was brief, interviewer took the time out to explain everything and was very professional.
Interview Questions: How can your previous skills apply to the position?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: very slow and require a lot for entry level positions which makes it stressful. Required 5 references within 24 hrs which seems excessive for non management roles that are entry level
Interview Questions: Why are you the best person for this role?

title: Adminstrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: It was a digital interview which you can do when you wanted. It was very convenient and a very easy process. I would recommend doing this kind of interview again.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: First round interview with director over Zoom. It felt more like a conversation than an interview- there was a significant amount of back and forth vs. getting drilled with questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was one round and very informal. We met at a coffee shop and the researcher got to know me and my qualifications as well as my time constraints as this was a part time position.
Interview Questions: Q: How are you with time management?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews with different people each time. Similar questions each time. Questions you can find online or on youtube. All the interviews were online which was nice.  The whole process took about two months.
Interview Questions: Star format questions. Tells us about a time.....

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with recruiter. It was a pretty chill interview. There was only one interview, no multiple rounds. The whole application and interview process took a couple weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: RA Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Croton-on-Hudson, NY) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Two rounds for me. The third round is with the professors you are going to work with. Only technical questions. The second round involves doing a data science project. The first round is a phone call.
Interview Questions: Why use logistic model instead of linear model?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty, cool not too difficult. Just be yourself, and really talk about your skills, past experience. Pretty simple, ask standard questions you usually hear. Please understand your job in great detail.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job? What skills could you bring to help you succeed in this position?

title: Web and Electronic Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds, and many of the questions were behavioral questions. There were not many technical questions. The interviewers were all very personable. They provided lots of information about Northwestern during the process, which was very helpful.
Interview Questions: What about this role is most interesting to you?

title: Associate Director of Student Life Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The individual I interviewed with was kind and honest. I received an offer to interview within a week of submitting my application. Communication was quick and clear. They let me know when I was not moving forward in their search.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The process was very easy and short. I had only one in-person interview that was about 30 minutes and accepted on the spot.I also toured the lab at the same time.
Interview Questions: The skills and qualifications I had for the job

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Write a personal statement followed by interviews with the faculty. Selection process is very difficult. Prior publications are a huge plus. Letter of recommendation from a famous professor can help. Research experience is necessary
Interview Questions: Research interests and past accomplishments

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I had an online interview.  The faculty asked questions about my previous research and projects. Whole process lasted for about one hour. Then I got my offer in less than a month.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous projects.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Kellogg HR reached out to me. Short interview with a professor asking you a few questions about yourself.  Professor talked briefly about the project he was working on. Offered the position shortly right after.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Skype Interview, standard questions but the messiness of the software made it so initially she was looking at a year old resume so after some redirection we had to get back on track.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What is your experience in social media?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview takes about 40 minutes, 4 questions in total, like a TOEFL test, each question has 1 minute to prepare and 2 minutes to speak. The last question is an essay to finish in 30 minutes. There were practice questions at the beginning of the test.
Interview Questions: How to deal with large amounts of reading and good quality essays.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: It was really streamlined; I met with three individuals, who all made me feel comfortable. They all asked different questions and gave me background on different aspects of the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and what interests you about this job.

title: Athletic Field Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Talk to multiple administrative officers about your work experience and reason for looking for on campus work. Not hard interview and is easier if you know people already working to vouch for you.
Interview Questions: What is one challenge you faced in your work life.

title: Grants and Contract Financial Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: First round interview with panel of three Assistant Directors. Second final round interview with Associate Director. Reference checks. Microsoft Excel assessment, English Language / Grammar written test. Whole process across Zoom Interviews -- span of 2.5 weeks
Interview Questions: How do you stay organized and prioritize multiple deadlines?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for several jobs with absolute qualifications and did not receive an acknowledgment that my resume was received.  I tried to contact the hiring manager but did not get a response. I realize the job market in COVID is well suited for employers, but it reflects poorly on the employer when they do not acknowledge the job seeker, even with a bot email response.
Interview Questions: Unfortunately, I did not get to answer any questions. I have two friends who have the same experience with Northwestern.

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Easy - online, video interview process with this company on their website online. very easy, straightforward pretty simple. not much more to say about this process aside from it being online with a video camera
Interview Questions: why work for us at this company?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: it was in zoom and they asked the typical questions like the question about my work experience, projects, tools. they asked about open-source language ,ubuntu and python. Also they did not let me know for any other steps.
Interview Questions: example of the Uber table in a database

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asked to fill out a form full of questions and was just blatantly told now afterwords even though I had previously worked there. The entire interview process was a joke
Interview Questions: What can you offer to the program

title: Center for Talent Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: After finding the job listing on an internal job posting site, I emailed the program director with my interest. I then had an interview with a program assistant to discuss past experience and day-to-day job activities, after which I was emailed with a decision.
Interview Questions: I was asked basic experience questions and questions abut familiarity with different softwares/programs being used.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Depends on department/research group, but normally a video call (in place of onsite interviews in current environment).   Overview of mission of research group/major project or initiative is standard as well.  No assessments/surveys unlike with a corporation as part of the process or evaluation of skills, recommendations from former/current employers and faculty are more common.
Interview Questions: Interest in research area, career goals, skills/experiences in manufacturing (etc, very generic)

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the NW website and then was contacted by email from the PI about 2.5 weeks later. We setup a 30min zoom call with the post-docs from the lab. They were very friendly, asked about my career goals and research experience.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to a position in In Alumni Relations & Development as a recent NU graduate with several internship and work experiences during undergrad with cover letter and resume, got a phone interview with HR probably two weeks later (I remember it not be immediately). HR person was really kind and sweet. 

Moved on to next round of in-person interviews with I believe 5-6 different people (about 20-30 minutes each one after the other, not a panel) in about 2.5 hours. Then  was invited for another round with I believe 4 different people which lasted maybe 1.5 to 2 hours. Younger/entry level staff were also really sweet and encouraging, but the senior staff were very stiff, hesitant and quite rude to some extent. Most used a standard template of interview questions. The questions were not hard and didn't catch me off guard but I was exhausted towards the end of each round having to present myself all over again several times. Again, it was the entry level staff that opened up the conversation that was more personable and organic, others were cold. Regardless, I am glad that I got to meet with most of the team as I did learn a lot about their dynamic, work style, culture, and how they operated as a team. I am thankful for that learning opportunity. 

After the second round of interviews, I was asked to complete the IBM Kenexa excel assessment (not too difficult if you study with youtube, though the exam's interface was not at all easy to navigate and sucked up a lot of my time, took me an hour instead of the recommended 30 minutes). In addition to that, I was asked to submit 5 references. The whole process probably lasted a month to a month and a half from application submission to decision. I was not offered the position and learned from my own search that another recent graduate was hired instead.

I was not working at the time but I can't imagine have been working full time and having to dedicate so much time to this process for a position that was offering only $19.50 in the description. I am more so upset that the process was so intensive that it required three rounds of interviews, 1 assessment, and 5 references, just to not receive any kind of feedback. I am not at all suggesting I am entitled to the position because I know there are many well-qualified and exceptional candidates applying to these positions. Yet, some courtesy and understanding to the amount of time and effort dedicated to the process would have been appreciated from the hiring manager. However, I was surprised that the HR person assigned to me still was sending other job openings my way even after I was rejected. I was very appreciative of that. I ended up applying to the temporary pool and got a part time position through there which was a much quicker and easier process, not at all as intensive. 

Overall, though it was not at all a positive experience, it wasn't the worst. Even reflecting during the process and after, I do not think I would have liked working in that specific department because I don't think my personality and values would have fit their "uppity" attitude if I am being honest.
Interview Questions: How deal with competing priorities? (As in, how do you organize your responsibilities?)

Interview Questions: What are my career ambitions?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager reached out to me via phone, she briefly discussed the role with me and we scheduled an in person interview. I met with two of her colleagues and their boss. I received a call back the following day with a verbal offer.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable with discussing abortion and other sensitive topics with pregnant women?

title: Assistant Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted by email a couple of weeks later to set up a phone interview. The phone interview went very well and was a positive experience. I was later contacted to come in for an in-person interview with 4 senior members of the department. The interviews were all conducted on time and each interviewer had varying degrees of interviewing style and difficulty over a total of 2.5 hours. At that point, I felt like it had been a good experience. 

Several days after the interview, the assistant that did my phone interview emailed me an update saying that she heard very positive things about my interview and would be in touch again soon. After another week went by, I emailed my interviewers for an update and they responded that they would be contacting me shortly with next steps and looked forward to reconnecting soon. The whole process was very long and drawn out, but still seemed to have a friendly, personal touch. 

Unfortunately, that personal touch was lost when, 4 long weeks after the in-person interview, I received a generic email from Northwestern's HR system stating that I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when a project that you were working on went horribly wrong.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview with straightforward questions. I was interviewed by at least three people and then had a follow-up interview with the Hiring Manager. Everyone was friendly and upfront about the responsibilities of the position.
Interview Questions: How do you work with difficult people?

title: Administrative Assistant/Patient Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted via email by the manager for phone interview then went to in person interview. Let me start by saying the manager was questionable, the posting was originally  listed as Admin Assistant and remained that way for at least a month. She had an in person interview with me and the next day the title of the posting was changed to a PSA, what my resume title was-I was shocked and confused when I saw that change!  So, the office manager  and the two girls who worked at the check in desk  interviewed me.. When interviewing with the manager she acted very nonchalant and rolled her eyes when I mentioned HIPAA, I use to work at one of the best teaching hospitals in the country so the eyes rolling left a pretty bad taste in my mouth. She also had forgotten what she had asked me during the phone interview, which didn't leave a great impression on me as well.
I then had to interview with the girls who worked a the front desk, they asked the usual questions. They also mentioned how the manager had forgotten to give them my resume, so they had no idea what my background was while speaking to me. They also had pads of paper in their hands that were strategically folded the whole time, so their previous notes didn't show. They also never wrote anything about me the whole time they were speaking to me and didn't bring pens in the room. Why did I say all that,  because if you aren't interested in someone just don't call them in for an interview! It was very apparent they had other candidates in mind and they ended up wasting my time. As I left the clinic I knew I didn't get the job and I was happy about it. It was a very un-stimulating work environment.
Interview Questions: Give an example of going above and beyond for a patient?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Process was very quick, took 2 days. Started with a phone screen from the manager and then a face to face interview with the director, manager and panel with the team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you made an impact on your team that you initiated.

title: Northwestern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Wixom, MI) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: A phone review took place that lasted approximately 15 minutes. This took place shortly after I submitted my resume and application for  the job. The interview was just a variety of questions regarding my skills with databases and if had the ability to work well in a highly professional workplace culture.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with databases?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Online app then face to face interview. 

Required to make a training  video with me performing task of the internship which I thought was pretty pointless.

Interviewer seemed pretty uninterested in the process overall and seemed they created an internship program just to say they have one.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Program Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Located through a recruiter. Initial interview was a phone screening, called back for in person the following week. Met with dept. manager, director and hr director. Received offer the following week.
Interview Questions: Behavioral

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I talked to a professor through the phone. I was referred to him through a friend and he linked me into the program. The process was very quick and easy and heard back in a few days.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in web design?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met with the hiring manager on the phone and then the coordinator in person. Ease and well informed. Received call back quickly from them regarding next steps. All staff was nice and helpful and did a great job.
Interview Questions: What my strengths are and how I excel.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and a few days later received an email to set up a phone interview. I will give them kudos for stepping into modern times and allowing candidates to schedule their own interviews online - it makes things so much easier.  My phone interview was with the Talent Acquisition Partner, and at the end he told me the next steps and told me he'd let me know either way in the next week or two, and even commented he knows how it feels to hear nothing so I'd be kept in the loop. That was the first week of April, and I didn't hear anything at all until I got the rejection email on 5/31. Obviously I figured out I wasn't moving forward when I didn't hear from him after a couple weeks, but it was disappointing to speak with someone who supposedly "gets it" and sets that expectation, and then disappears.
Interview Questions: Basic phone screen - tell me about yourself, what's your salary expectation, etc

title: Director Marketing, MBA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was exceptional -- all interviews were conducted as predicted, were on time, concise and to the point. They did a fantastic job of relaying the scope of the job, their need for a new position, and the parameters of the role. This was an enjoyable interview experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me about how your past experience has led you to apply for this role?

title: Student Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Laid-back and pretty chill. Spoke with the IT director of the Media and Design Studio. He had done extensive work in Northwestern's IT program, but he was also a really cool guy.
Interview Questions: Came in and talked about myself, passions, interests, etc. Then was asked to explain a piece of code that I wrote on my GitHub.

title: Regulatory Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The original interview process was intended as 1 panel interview. For my own experience, it was split into a panel and a single 1-on-1 due to the absence of key staff members. Staff is very friendly and open.
Interview Questions: My past experiences both educational and job related were discussed. One question they did ask me was if I ever disagreed with a superior regarding any matter or decision. The interview itself went well and flowed very casually.

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Long, complicated and unclear.  I had to wait a long time to hear back after the interview which was needlessly stressful.  It seems like there is a real disconnect between HR on campus and the departments that do the hiring.
Interview Questions: The usual.

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply Online, Phone interview, you'll get it is you aren't a horrible person and have worked with kids in the past, Very chill and no pressure, the application is just a resume and cover letter with some questions
Interview Questions: Typical why do you want to work for us, relevant experience, ect

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for research assistants is basically all behavioral. The Principal Investigator of the lab (PI) really just wants to see that you are interested in the work of the lab, and that you're intellectually curious. If you show (or fake) commitment, that's all that you need! They truly just are looking for people thirsty for knowledge, and so it isn't anything to stress over.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this lab?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard grad student interview: information session in the morning, interview with 3 PIs in the afternoon, meet with current grad students in the afternoon, hit the town with students at night. The only stressful part is meeting with the PIs, but it's completely dependent on which PIs you get.
Interview Questions: Draw a neuron and the action potentials along the axon. What happens to the action potentials if you apply tetrodotoxin to the midpoint of the axon?

title: Associate Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: After I applied online, they sat me down in a room with the manager and three of the senior students working at the support center. They ask some questions in the first part of the interview and do a practice phone call by talking out loud. After that, you do a practice call at an actual phone.
Interview Questions: Who sets up the wireless or troubleshoots the technical issues in your house?

title: Phonathon Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews with the supervisor over the phone. She was just trying to have an idea of your personality and style of calling. It went really well, and she was really nice and positive during the interview.
Interview Questions: What would you say if you want me to donate 200 dollars to Northwestern?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied via HR career site. Got email from hiring person and set up a phone interview. In 30 minute interview I learned about the position and its expectations. I then was asked few questions and of course they said we still have other interviewers and will call you either way by a certain time. Once I heard that, I knew I'll never hear from them again.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize and handle work under pressure?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: First did a phone interview and then was called down for an in-person interview. Interviewed with three people total (the principal investigator, a research associate and another research assistant with whom I would be working). Overall, the interview lasted about 2 hours at the clinic where I would be working.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern?

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had an hour long phone interview followed by a 3 hour interview with several members of the team and other teams that work closely with the department. The questions ranged from my level of comfort with RESTful web services and database management.
Interview Questions: How my former supervisor was going to take the news if I got the position.

title: Financial Aid Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for an interview at the end of August, the question were pretty clear and simple, the ambiance was quite and relaxed! I was asked questions what I did on my previous job and why I think I'm the good candidate!
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I had a very positive interview experience with Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine for a communications coordinator position. I applied online and had a phone interview about two weeks after applying. My phone interview was with a wonderful/ cheerful HR person, we talked about my skills and why I was interested in the role. 

Two weeks after my phone interview I had the in-person interview and met with about five people for 30 minutes each. Every person was friendly and seemed really interested in my skills. I also took a 15-minute proofreading test. 

I was told that I would be notified in two weeks about a decision but I didn't get a notification until almost two months later. The process was very positive and one of the best interview experience while doing my job search.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: since i was here during my Ph.D i didn't go for interview process. I just talked with Ph.D advior and he accepted it. Therefore it was quite easy for me.
Interview Questions: he asked what is your long term plan

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Detroit, MI) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: 2 phone interviews only. It was very casual and relaxed, the lab manager I interviewed with was very easy to talk to and it was not formal. It was a two way street.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: For this position, I spoke with an administrator as the means of a phone screening.  It was a very brief conversation asking about my prior experience and qualification. Additionally the administrator spoke about the professor and the research he was conducting.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The over the phone interview was 35 minutes about my experience and what my expectatins were regarding the benefits and pay. The in person  interview was with 2 primary investigators and a project manager discussing different parts of my resume.
Interview Questions: They asked me how I  handle conflict resolution with patients

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I met my adviser in person and we went through a lot of question on both work and life.
It was more like two-way. I asked the research environment in NU and he asked about my research history.
Interview Questions:
- What projects have you worked on?
- What is your main research interest?
- What is your final goal?

title: Assistant Professor In Residence Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: A pair of straightforward interviews as I was partially an internal hire. Minimal application packet. The approval process took a considerable amount of time including an FBI background check required by Qatar
Interview Questions: How do you feel about living in Qatar?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Average length of time between submitting my resume and cover letter and getting invited in for an interview.  Interviewers were nice and on-tome.  The panel interviews were good.
Interview Questions: If you were a shoe, what part would you be and why.

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really easy for my job. I emailed my resume to the head scientific director and had a 20 min interview. Afterwards, I went into the office of the head scientific director and he asked me to sit down. He then talked about what the role was like - mainly working with Excel and transporting blood samples. Then he asked me to tell him about myself. After 20 mins, he said I was hired.
Interview Questions: What is your passion? How did you like your school experience right now?

title: Graduate Student (Chemistry) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. Students were selected prior to arrival to the university. The department did its best to bring in the accepted students with a visit weekend filled with special food and events.
Interview Questions: There were no specific questions asked, just general questions about the previous type of research that was performed.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview with Principal Investigator, followed by a meet-and-greet with the rest of the lab members.  I was asked about my previous research experience, and why I was interested in the position I was applying for.   Beforehand, I researched the lab itself to get a good sense of what they worked on, so  I came prepared with questions of my own for the PI.
Interview Questions: What is your previous lab experience?  Explain some of the scientific concepts/techniques that were employed in that previous laboratory experience.

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interviewer sent an email requesting to meet at her office at 8 a.m......I was there but she was not.  She later called the office and said she was at the hospital.  Now I have to leave and go to the hospital to interview with her.  we met in a storage area between two elevators....very unprofessional.  then I went back to the office to meet with 3 more staff members.  Who have no input in the hiring process.
Interview Questions: she had basic interview questions and the other 3 staff members wanted to get a "feel"  for me

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: This face-to-face  interview was a pre-screening for potential temp and temp to full-time positions at the Evanston campus.  Prior to the interview, they required me to take proficiency tests for Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Powerpoint.  There were lots of forms to fill out.  They requested my permission to do an extensive screening (background, drugs, etc) if I were offered a job.
Interview Questions: I explained to them that I wanted temp or temp-to-full-time but they asked additional questions to make sure that I was actually flexible and not giving them the answer they wanted to hear.

title: Bioinformatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Showed up about an hour early. Checked in, and greeted by two police officers. Have never been arrested in my life mind you. Apparently, HR has put me on a watch list, as I was fired from NU about 4 years prior, and had the audacity of filing formal complaints against my then supervisor and appealing the termination to HR. How dare I consider taking legal action when my then boss has threatened me with physical violence, commented on my weight, and refers to women in STEM as "unproductive baby makers". Who wouldn't want to work for someone like that?!
Interview Questions:
Who are you?

You have an appointment?

Who are you?

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was brought back on three separate occasions over three weeks to interview with faculty members that decided they wanted to be involved in the hiring process. I got the sense that they had a candidate at my third and final interview with three members from the Astronomy and Physics department because of a lack of interest and questions regarding my relevant work experience and education. I later found out the next week that they had chose a candidate that one of the interviewees knew personally. I felt they lacked professionalism in dragging the process out which resulted in my loss of two days PTO.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions - describe a time when....etc.

title: Senior Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had one phone interview with first.  There were two interviewers, and I was asked basic questions about my experience and background.  Then I was invited for an on-site interview, which lasted about four hours.  I was interviewed by several people and met with several different groups.  I showed samples of my work and gave a presentation/training demonstration.  Later I had another phone interview with someone who could not attend the in-person interview.  Finally, I was invited for a second on-site interview which lasted several hours and included meetings with several different people, some of whom I had met before, and some new people.  Although the multi-step process was rather long and arduous, everyone was very kind and professional, and it was very well organized, and I got the opportunity to learn a lot about the organization and the position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle technical challenges during training?

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process was online. There were two interviews with the program coordinator. It was very relaxed and easy going. There was a huge focus on child safety and the atmospheres they would be exposed to.
Interview Questions: What are your thoughts on child safety.

title: Enrollment Coordinator, School of Professional Studies Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through the university's HR page. I heard back from HR about scheduling a phone interview about 4-5 weeks after I submitted my application. The phone interview lasted about 30 minutes and went well. The HR person was very friendly. At the end of the call, she said I would be hearing back soon about scheduling an in-person interview. She also asked about my salary requirements which was pretty standard. 

I heard back from a different HR person about 3 weeks after the phone interview wanting to schedule a panel interview with the hiring manager plus three members of the department. I had my in person interview about two weeks after scheduling it. When I arrived, the HR person that I had scheduled the panel interview with greeted me. It was a little stressful when she was trying to figure out what room to put me in. She walked me into a huge meeting of NU employees which was very embarrassing because they abruptly told her "wrong room!" She then took my back down stairs only to bring me back up to the same room where I eventually gave a 10-minute presentation to four people. Once the presentation was over I had a 50-minute panel interview which seemed to go well. 

The people were very friendly for the most part. They seemed interested in my background but were a little unprofessional as they had their lunch delivered during my interview which was disruptive and rude. Otherwise, I thought the interview went well and the people were very open to having a discussion about the job and my experience rather than just asking questions. 

I heard back about 10 days later after I sent a follow-up email to the HR person. She got right back to me saying that I didn't get the job. I did find it unprofessional that they didn't get back to me on their own especially after the amount of prep time and interview time I had spent.
Interview Questions: Last pitch, why should we hire you?

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is fairly straightforward. Apply for the job. You get an email response expressing interest in a few weeks. You respond back and set up a date for an in-person interview. Once you're interviewed by the manager, and they like you, you're introduced to the staff on the same day and then meet with the PI of the study if all goes well. In the meantime reference checks are completed. The offer letter is made via email and confirmed only after a background check.
Interview Questions: What was particularly interesting to me about the research study?

title: Bioinformatician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Just a phone interview asking questions about working with output files from certain machines. Honestly the best interview I've had with a research lab manager. Usually they are not so specific in their questions.
Interview Questions: What is your background, what types of machines have your worked with?

title: Financial Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was set up with three staff members with the department and one HR staff member from the school/unit itself. No compensation questions were discussed with the department staff members, all compensation questions and negotiations took place with the HR staff member.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified candidate for this role?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Repetitive, outdated questions. No advantage to being an internal candidate. Demoralized by hiring of external candidate. Process took abnormally long and ultimately caused a waste of time and delay in major life event plans. While other candidates had several interviews, I had one day of interviews. I spent 5 hours in a conference room and met the hiring committee for 30 minutes each. Interviews were too short and several interviewers were late, shortening the interview even further.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you had to manage up.

title: Statistical Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a fairly informal process. Meetings w/ the current team, senior leadership, project managers, etc.

No difficult questions pertaining to software development/engineering. Mostly questions pertaining to educational experience and exposure to various topics.
Interview Questions: Questions pertained to applying quantitative methods and statistical analysis tools (specifically STATA but depending on the department, other tools were welcome).

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received an email requesting a phone interview on Friday morning for times on Monday or Tuesday. I spoke with a liason for the department for about 40 minutes. They did ask about my salary requirements and saved time for me to ask questions of my own.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you have to suggest an idea to your superiors and the outcome of that situation.

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received an email initially, and then a phone call (as apparently the email had gotten filtered out of my inbox). The phone call was with a small panel and took about 45 minutes, basic questions library services. I scheduled an in person interview, which took about a half-day, and was requested to create a short presentation. Everything was straightforward, staff was friendly, and it was easy to prepare with the information I was provided.
Interview Questions: Tell us about an unsuccessful training session; how did you change your approach after the fact?

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with my immediate boss and the senior management for my first interview; for my second interview, I met the entire team. It was a relatively painless process and I felt at ease.
Interview Questions: They asked me to clarify my goals for the position as well as my understanding of the administrative nature of the work. I also received standard questions, like telling them about myself and past experiences related to the job, as well as my best/worst qualities.

title: Research Technologist III Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was great. There were two rounds of interview. One you clear phone interview, you will have panel interview,  and finally HR. The process takes 25 days. It was pretty average, they will ask more technical.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans.

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Ann Arbor, MI) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Northwestern HR contacted me and set up a date and time for an interview with the Dr. It was a phone Interview since I lived out of state. Then I would go to Chicago for an on-site interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the website, heard back from the department director through email to arrange interview times. First we had a phone call, talking briefly about my experience and basic information. Then scheduled an in-person interview where I learned about how the system works, what my role will be like, etc.
Interview Questions: My previous experience and skills

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I have interviewed for 2 positions at Northwestern University. I never received a decision from either department I met with; Psychiatry and Preventive Medicine.  While I understand the job search and interviewing process, and also appreciate that these people are busy-- it is rude and unprofessional not to give a response. I traveled and spent money to come for these interviews, and see it as a common courtesy for these professionals to at least send a short response e-mail.  This University has a wonderful reputation, and even small things like this tarnishes it. 

(Dept of Preventive Medicine update, 3 weeks after asking for a follow-up: I was interviewed by the Primary Investigator (PI)& a group of their research team. The PI finally responded to me saying one of his researchers stated she called me with their decision. I never received a call from her. And I know it's not a "technology issue" because her phone didn't have issues calling me & doing a 40minute phone interview. Clearly she's fibbing to her PI. There would have been no need to lie if she had given me a response when she said she would.)
Interview Questions: Education, work experience, related skills, why you are interested in specific position.

title: Project Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through the former Project Cafe (now since re-branded as FFRA). I went through 5 rounds: a prelim phone screen, an in-depth phone screen, an in-person review with two people, then an in-person with 7 people, followed by a luncheon with a few people, then finally a one-on-one with the director of the department. The process, though long works, is thorough and helps identify the best candidate.
I wish others were as thoughtful in the process.
Interview Questions: How would you handle X scenario or Y personnel problem?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Began with a phone interview and was them brought in two additional times to meet with support staff as well as director level staff. There was a group interview as well as one on one with upper level management. The atmospher was casual and not high stakes.
Interview Questions: What strengths do you believe you would bring to the office?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
