Interview Descriptions: I received an email about a week after submitting the application. The Skype interview was two days later. I was told they would make their decision in 2-3 weeks, but never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time you had to create order out of chaos.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Met with a few different professors over 2 days, attended a poster event, a few lectures, and a few social events. Professors asked questions about our interest level in the program, our backgrounds, and also expected us to ask engaging scientific questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this field?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Long, slow interview process. Very thorough and informative. Dedicated to process and students. Multiple interview rounds. Received a call 4 months after initial application. Asked a lot of questions about past experiences.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot of questions about past experiences.

title: Research Technologist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was very nice and explained her position well.  Kept the position very vague in terms of the extent of the job description.  Toured around the facility.  Was not very communicative outside of interview process, done only by the administrative assistant.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this position?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had a very smooth process. All the questions asked are relevant to my job. I did some review before going to the interview. It does help. So going through some algorithm books before the interview.
Interview Questions: what is your plan in 10 years?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I had a Phone screen with recruiter. I was then set up for a group interview with three people. The interview was based on behaviorial interview questions with each person asking a question then on to the next.
Interview Questions: Behaviorial interview questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a generic college application where I followed the stated guidelines to apply. The process was very straightforward as it is for other universities. After a wait of a couple of months, I heard back with a posiitve reply.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my intended plan of action for my studies

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked a lot of questions about what kind of worker I am, what kind of work environment I like, and how I respond to certain situations. It was a good interview and they were very professional.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a disgruntled customer or colleague.

title: Associate Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple, relevant and straightforward. It was a group interview with a panel who asked me to guide them through a couple of user support questions. They require significant commitment so beware of that as you won't enjoy if you don't devote time.
Interview Questions: 1. guide an old person through a computer

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two day interview process. I was provide with a hotel and all meals and was flown out for the interview. The interview was structured as a round robin, with interviews with over 12 professors scattered over 2 days.
Interview Questions: Do you know which advisor you are most interested in working with?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple.Talked about my research experience and what i can bring to the lab.I had to provide professional references and get recommendation letters from them which took about a week.Not a hectic experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Durham, NC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned by individual researchers. Quarterly work requirements and schedules must be discussed with the Supervisor to ensure that the work priorities can be accomplished in the 220 work hours scheduled for the quarter (for a normal half-time appointment). Concerns about any additional responsibilities should be discussed first with the supervisor (faculty researcher), and then the Graduate Program Committee Chair or the Department Chair.

Policies on workload, vacation and paid leave are included in this contract. Vacation and paid leave must be approved by the supervisor. Documentation of leave approvals must be maintained per Department of Economics and UW Human Resources policy.
Interview Questions: what is your interest of research

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted by my advisor, it is a case by case thing. Most likely, you will be prepared to answer the questions related to your research and your prior working/research experience. Most of the time, it is not difficult.
Interview Questions: Academic stuff

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via the NU website. I submitted my resume, but not a cover letter even thought they asked for one. There were also a handful of background questions to answer online. I was contacted by HR about two weeks later and had my first 15 minute interview with someone from HR who could not have been nicer. She asked really easy questions and gave me plenty of opportunity to brag about myself. After that I met with the hiring manager and I was stumped a few times by her questions (they were not unreasonable, I just could have been more prepared. A week or so later I met with the hiring manager again and she told me that I would not be offered the position. I was already an employee for Northwestern and I currently still am. My own manager was very helpful with process.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult. A lot of customer service related questions, what if you have a disagreement with a coworker, how organized are you, etc.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Waited for 10 minutes, then proceeded to first of 3 interviews.  All 3 interviews went well, although I had a feeling that they had already filled the position internally.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with budgets?

title: Web Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process seemed to move along quickly after decisions were made. HR and hiring manager reached out via e-mail so at times there was more than one stream of information given. When initial offer was made over phone, only salary and start date were presented. NU gives 48 hours for an offer reply. It seemed to be expected that candidate accept/decline offer and then an acceptance confirmation with offer details is sent via e-mail. Negotiation regarding salary is not recommended nor does it seem to be expected for this position because it's an entry level position and because NU is in the higher-ed industry and rates are comparable to non-profits. Start date was flexible but ASAP seemingly due to fiscal year restrictions.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had to teach someone something.
What is your area of interest?
How do you prioritize when you have many things to do?
Tell me about your job history and why you're here today.
What do you look for in your ideal work environment?
What is your experience with web development?
Describe a time when a client was unhappy with your work (was asked this twice).
What did you do when your teammate did something well?
How do you deal with rude people?
What is something you wish to develop about yourself?

title: Academic Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
After submitting my resume and basic information through their HR website and submitting my supplemental application where they asked questions about why I would fit the position, I was contacted for a phone interview a week later. The Summer Program Director contacted me and she was very friendly and open to answering any questions during the interview. 

She asked questions about my work experience, and some behavioral questions which were not difficult. The questions were about working on a team, logistical planning, and assessing your strengths and weaknesses. She then provided time at the end for to ask any questions about the program. She then said she contact me within a week, and I was provided with a job offer about two days after the interview. 

Overall I had a very positive interview experience, and because of the exciting and engaging work the program does I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: There really were not any difficult questions.

title: Web Content Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview by recruiter. This was followed by an In-person interview with hiring manager and potential group of co-workers. No follow-up after in-person interview. Ideally, there should have been a phone interview with the hiring manager before an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Interviewer asked for what I considered my area of specialization in web development. This was odd, considering it was a multi-role position.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Mostly just general questions about myself and experience. No behavioral questions. Nothing difficult or complicated. Just had to show interest and competency. Was contacted by the lab manager via email about 2 weeks later offering me the job
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in psychology research?

title: PhD Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got the opportunity to interview with Corning (the glass company) because of one of my group members, who got an internship with them the previous year. It was a phone interview. We basically set up the schedule via email first and the interviewer called to ask some basic behavior questions.
Interview Questions: How to summarize your research?

title: Financial Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with three people, individually with each of them at first and then with everyone at the end. All of the Interviewers were women. They all asked the same kinds of questions and it didn't seem like they planned the whole thing out very well. The questions were all easy, more about myself than my experience or the position.
Interview Questions: What are your career ambitions and how do you see Northwestern fitting in to those goals.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Applying to graduate school is a complex situation that is detailed in blogs and books available all over the internet. The key point for a social science position was to make sure I had developed a connection with the research faculty I wanted to work with beforehand. After applying, I was invited to a 'visiting weekend' where the applicants get to meet and chat with faculty and current students. This is usually a full-day (or more) of meeting and interviewing with multiple people in the department; which feels much more like a meet and greet than an interview. This is fairly standard practice for graduate recruitment, and is used to assess fit between the applicant and graduate program. In general, I had a very smooth interview process and found out the decision a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: This was a fairly relaxed interview process, but one difficult question I did receive was to justify my desired methods for research that I wished to pursue.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The project manager emailed about an in-person interview (no phone interview), and it was a panel-style interview. Overall, it was fair with challenging questions about my experience and how I've worked with people in the past.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with multiple stakeholders?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
The Hiring Manager emailed to schedule after about 20 day later of applying online
I was late to the interview because I was not able to find parking. Once I got to the office, I quickly met with the with the Manager. Standard questions were asked, the manager provided a relaxing environment. I had the opportunity to also be interviewed by an employee. The whole process took about 1.5 hours. A week later, HR contacted me to start the background check. Two weeks after, I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Salary expectation

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basically a pretty informal talk with the professor, just discussing my past research experience, what skills I have and what my thoughts were on some of his ongoing research. Since he liked my publications, I think it ws just to see whether personality-wise it would be a good fit
Interview Questions: Q: How does your skill set help the reserach in my lab?

title: Research and Content Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume to the recruitment for the Center for Talent Development. They reviewed it then got back to me for an in person interview. In person interview was very easy, just let them know why you want the job and your relevant skills that will make you succeed. Be detail-oriented and nice and you should be fine
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Meet with head engineer or biologist depending on position, just sat in office and talked about past projects and experiences and the goals of the lab and specific things that would be required of position. however, nothing said in interview about projects that would be upcoming actually happened, such is the nature of research. mostly looking for self-motivated, detail-oriented, and team-players.
Interview Questions: They asked about experience working with teams and on team projects, comfort traveling abroad, and working in an ambiguous environment

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very smoothly and I was hired immediately.  There was nothing uncomfortable, both the manager and director were both easy to talk with.  This is an excellent company to work for.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was about salary expectation.

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: A month after I applied for the position a recruiter emailed me about 6 questions to answer, it was pretty much an email interview.  After 2 months a different recruiter emailed me inviting me for a phone interview.  The phone interview went well, very standard questions.  I was told the next step in the process is the hiring committee reviewing all the notes from the phone interviews and deciding who they wanted to invite for face to face interviews.  I was told I would be contacted within the next two weeks.  It has been a month and I still have not heard anything yet.
Interview Questions: In what area do I need to improve?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral questions were asked along with experience and what would you do in given situation. Most basic questions you can expect in the interview process. Your experience and why you are a good fit for the company.
Interview Questions: What's your weakness?

title: Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Northwestern's interview process was very warm & friendly. After applying via their website I was contacted through email. Then there was a phone interview. The next step was a in-person interview. During the phone portion I was interviewed by 2 people. During the in-person portion I was interviewed by 3 people and I had to present a workshop to a team of 5-10 people.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were general. The only thing I was worried about was the workshop presentation, but the NU team was very helpful and answered any questions I had.

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was phone interview, with the standard questions- not too difficult but they expect you to know the positions you are applying to very well. It looks like a good working environment and good culture.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a boss.

title: Statistical Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Day long interviews are set up by an administrative assistant, after which you meet with several faculty and staff.  Generally, you meet with personnel in the specific department that you're applying for (oncology, internal medicine, etc). Interviews last somewhere between 15 minutes and 1 hour. Lunch is included.
Interview Questions: The most difficult questions were about bioinformatics techniques. If you work in -omics data (proteomics, genomics, etc), this shouldn't be a problem for you.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Got responses the second day I sent in my resume and transcript;  scheduled a meeting/interview for two days later. The interview lasted for ~30 minutes and the professor asked for self-introduction, past research experience, experiences of problem solving and interests for this particular project and ideas on it. After the interview she asked me to hand in an "assignment", where I needed to find a related article, summarise it and explain what can be learned from it to use in our project
Interview Questions: Since the professor is just starting the project, I was asked on my opinions of future plans and potential difficulties, as well as how I might solve it

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
They needed someone ASAP and I was available ASAP, plus it was a good fit! They offered me the job the night of the interview.

When we hired other people later on, it was really important to us that the person was also young and eager to learn / gain experience for med/ grad school. If they weren't sure they wanted to job we would skip them since in that case they probably wouldn't like the job.

I wouldn't have gotten the interview unless I had met someone in the office. I volunteered in a different department for about 6 months before getting this opportunity. They love referrals because it makes it easy for them! Raking through the HR website isn't easy for the hiring managers.
Interview Questions: How I can handle stressful situations, testing how I would react with certain unexpected situations with patients, understanding my career goals, wanting to know when I could start.

title: Research Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions:
I contacted the PI of the lab I work in directly. Interview was fairly straight forward. The most important part was to show interest in the research and ask many follow up questions about the specific research topic. 

An important note about the online application submission system: I experienced some trouble with the FASIS website. When I emailed PIs saying I applied to their lab through the job they listed on the system, they would search for it and my application would sometimes not appear in their records. Although I received a confirmation through the FASIS system, when I called the application was not in their records. Therefore, I would recommend contacting FASIS to make sure they received your application, just to be 100% sure.
Interview Questions: Nothing was particularly unexpected but they asked a lot of trenchant questions about the research I conducted in the past.

title: Senior Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: After applying through NU's career portal, generally communication is done through an assistant to coordinate interviews. Meeting with several PI's/administrators, and then once a job offer has been provided, you work with the Center's business administrator/HR to accept or negotiate the salary and start date. The interviews were quite relaxed, however I had to interview with 5 different people over 2 different periods of time, which made it difficult because I was traveling down from the far northwestern suburbs.
Interview Questions: It is important that you have a background in the specialty of the department/center. You are expected to know what is being researched, and generally what the research goals and processes are.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: As always for a scientist - it's all about who you know.  I asked to work for this lab, then interviewed and gave a presentation.  I did have to submit three recommendations as well, but that was the extent of the hiring and interview process for me.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Professor selected me because I did well in his class. I told him I was interested and he told me about the position. This is the key thing about getting a position like this at NU. Do well in the course, get along well with the professor, and then show interest in the work.
Interview Questions: Do you want to do research over the summer?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: After I applied I was contacted and asked to come in for one interview that was very basic. There weren't really any questions about my character or my future goals. The interview was really just for the professor conducting it to assess what experience I had and how it could be beneficial to their study, so the majority of the interview was just me being asked to elaborate on what I had on my resume.
Interview Questions: Could you describe your work experience that best prepares you for this position?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was overseas so it all happened via Skype. There were 3 rounds of interviews. First one was general to see if I can tie my shoes I guess. The second one was technical and the last was in between the two.
Interview Questions: Will it be difficult getting back to class after taking a break for years?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got the interview for Program Assistant at Northwestern and was able to set up a convenient time quickly on site. The interview was extremely informal and conversational. I barely got to speak about my experiences or how I would be a great candidate for the role. Nonetheless, my soon to be boss and I really hit it off and have a great relationship that was initiated in that interview.
Interview Questions: I wasn't asked any direct questions aside from how I would manage the commute daily.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Talked with a few group members about their research. Gave a presentation on my own research. Had lunch with PI and two group members. Gave an offer the same day after my interview and talked about salary at the same time.
Interview Questions: It is a very technical question about my research.

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Professional, no crazy questions to throw you off guard. Great conversation, getting to know your skills and accomplishments and getting to know your process. The project director was there as well as the person that I would be working directly under. They got to know me a little and shared some common ground between us which was very helpful.
Interview Questions: What was the most challenging thing you needed to do? How did you overcome it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process consisted of a variety of forms and challenges to be completed throught their online website for the university.  After following various links through the applications, I was prompted to submit letters of recommendation, despite the fact that the internship was relatively not popular.  My professors wrote excellent letters of recommendation and yet I was still not admitted to the REU Prorgam.
Interview Questions: recommendations

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward. They brought us in and just spoke to us a little bit to get a sense of whether or not we knew what sort of research was being conducted at SONIC. They also wanted to see if we had much interest in research for the social sciences. I was asked what I wanted to do post-graduation and how much time I could typically commit to the position.
Interview Questions: What song do you think you embody?

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
First, I met with the supervisor I would be working for. She asked me questions concerning my experience and how I might tackle the job responsibilities.

Then I met with a professor who wanted me to do a special assignment while I was working there, as part of my job duties. I had to demonstrate a working knowledge of MS Access.

Last, the supervisor called my references.
Interview Questions: How do you work with challenging or difficult personalities?

title: Center for Talent Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview, that mainly consisted of questions related to the position. Lots of hypothetical situations that might come up on the job. Also walked through my resume, and asked me about my eduction history and extracurriculars. Then, about a week or week and a half after the phone interview, I got a call saying that I had been selected for an offer, and was given 2 weeks to respond. I accepted the offer, and enjoyed working there
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience dealing with difficult clients/customers?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Mostly we're technical question. Detailed research experience, courses that had been taken, describe a course project,difficulties and how did you solve them. Basically technical questions. Professors care more about whether what you did matched their research topics.
Interview Questions: Previous research experience

title: Senior Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (North Charleston, SC) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by three lady directors. Initially it was a phone interview for about an hour and then I was asked to come to the site. At site I was interview by at least 10 people. It was a tiring day.
Interview Questions:
why do we need to select you

Discuss your educational background.
Describe yourself.
Tell me how you handled a difficult situation.
Why should we hire you?
Why are you looking for a new job?
Would you work holidays/weekends?
Give a time when you went above and beyond the requirements for a project.
Who are our competitors?
What was your biggest failure?
What motivates you?
What’s your availability?
Who’s your mentor?
Tell me about a time when you disagreed with your boss.
How do you handle pressure?
What is the name of our CEO?
What are your career goals?
What gets you up in the morning?
What would your direct

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: CV review and interview
Interview Questions: what are you going to do as a postdoc

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: A face to face talk, in a relaxed atmosphere.
Interview Questions: just explain what you know

title: Research Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Required to apply for all positions online. Cover letter is not required but highly recommended.  To increase your chances of getting an interview, try to find the hiring manager on NU directory based on the job description. Email hiring manager with your résumé and cover letter.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Was very casual and however was willing to listen to your story. It was not too time consuming but they showed that they cared about your research. Your presentation was reviewed by a group panel and you had personal interview with all the team members. This not only improved my exposure but it also help me evaluate the team and access whether I will be a good fit.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to our institutional values

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: This highly depends on the PI and the lab environment. Northwestern is a highly ranked university so it is important to have a good publication record and established set of lab skills before approaching faculty. Every PI has a different method in interviews and hiring, usually involving an individual meeting with the applicant and a research presentation of the applicant's past findings with current group members.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Purchasing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Very nice people with in the purchasing dept. The interviews are 2 parted and are very thorough. They ask the typical questions you would see and are nice enough to share their experiences and outlooks on the position. The first part of the interviews are done by employees in the dept and if you make it to the 2nd interviews you are then reviewed/interviewed by upper management.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult, hardest question is answering what is your worst quality that you need to work on.

title: Construction Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1 phone interview, 2 face to face interview with total of 6 managers. it was mostly about types of projects i had worked on in the past, and how it could possibly apply to current job description or requirements
Interview Questions: nothing difficult, pretty standard

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Normal questions, review our background.  Wanted to know about SOP experience  and ability to develop SOPS.  More time was listening to the interviewer.  Easy going interview with the Director and Medical Director.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience writing SOPs?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very straightforward, just asked about previous experience
Interview Questions: Describe recent projects

title: Research Assistance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I apply directly to the professor. Then the professor ask me to his office and talk about the work for the research. Then, we talked about the relative courses and projects I have done before. He have a great interest about my research, then we talk about the detail of my latest research. He found my research topic is relative with his topic, then I admit me as his research assistance.
Interview Questions: What courses have you enrolled?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening followed by 2 in face sessions covering customer service and technical network and wireless questions.
Interview Questions: 802.11Q antenna coverage pattern and client loading setup question.

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Applied online a few days later was contacted to set up phone interview. Completed phone interview. Was asked questions about previous experience and ability to work as a part of a team, how to handle pressure/or multiple responsibilities. Staff who interviewed me were friendly. Communication after interview was great. Keep me informed of next steps so I wasn't left guessing.
Interview Questions: Questions were pretty standard. I prepared my answered based on typically expected interview questions.

title: Recruiting Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer asked questions off a list.  Impersonal and robotic, did not seem at all interested in my responses.  Seemed they had already found a candidate and should not have done the phone interview with me.
Interview Questions: All questions  were standard

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went smoothly. First I interviewed the temp center then i interviewed with the HR department Manager. She was very welcoming and easy to talk to. Everyone in the office was very friendly and welcoming. The Staffing manager asked me typical interview questions based on my experience, education and my interest in human resources. After the interview i received a link for a background check. Once my results returned they presented me with an offer.
Interview Questions: What interest you about working in higher education?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and casual interview with tour of the lab. I interviewed with the lab manager, then met the other members of the group. It was very laid back and enjoyable.
Interview Questions: What made you want to be a scientist?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive, many people. But just one day, which is good. Still, not knowing with whom I was interviewing made it difficult for me to be prepared on which subjects to speak. Professionalism and stamina are important, to be able to remain enthusiastic when repeating some of the same answers to different groups.
Interview Questions: What experience do you bring with you to this role?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the Higher Education program.  Interview had a phone screening with two staff members, and a 1/2 day on campus interview within the office.  This graduate assistantship was in Northwestern's division of student affairs.
Interview Questions: How have your experiences prepared you for working with multicultural students?

title: Research Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I submitted the online application which as followed by a telephonic screening from the PI. The screening was primarily based on the resume, background and project requirements. The position was a great fit to my ME background and I was fairly comfortable in explaining what I had done in the past. A couple of weeks passed after the call when I received an offer for the position I was interviewed for.
Interview Questions: Mainly centered on the background and project requirements.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The HR calls you to ask questions and see if you qualify for another round - to meet with the hiring manager. If you pass you get the chance to meet with the hiring manager and their team. They ask you about yourself and then you may ask about the position. Some interviewers look so disinterested that your excitement about the position takes nosedive after few minutes into the interview.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions on how you would handle various situations

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through someone who worked there. Got an interview with two people. Boss and DA. Heard back next day that I got it.
Interview Questions: Nothing too difficult that I can remember.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions:
1. Job Talk: could choose any topic to talk about; 30-40 minutes. I presented part of my master's thesis.
2. One on one interview with the program director, associate dean, and individual faculty in or our of the search committee.
3. Lunch with the program director and some students.
4. Teaching demo: one hour
Interview Questions: Can't think of any. Everyone was very friendly. Asked lots of questions about my interest in teaching and research, not in a critical way.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview is fairly OK. You will meet many professors in your department of interest. Then you will talk with them one by one. They will show you their research interest and ask about your research interest to make sure that they match with your. They might ask about what classes that you took and what research experiences that you have.
Interview Questions: What research experience that you have during your undergrad or master?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer disparaged the employer openly, challenged on CV SPECIFICS BY ONE EMPLOYEE in interview, it was very bizarre and I'm glad I walked out and never looked back because I found great work elsewhere
Interview Questions: N/A

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern University
Interview Descriptions: Apply and get accepted or denied.
Interview Questions: No interview necessary.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview first and then a full day onsite interview (9a-5p).  Interviewed with multiple faculty members of the specific department, presented a lecture with Q&A (to show my teaching/research), and interviewed with individual department leaders.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The professors asked me about my research interests. It was basically what projects I have done in the past, what techniques I used and whom I worked with. Did I published any papers and also what I want to do after graduation. Then he introduced a bit about his research groups, what they do and a little bit about the members. Finally, he asked if I wanted to come for a visit during April.
Interview Questions: Just research interest, some background in resume

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial meeting with group leader. Gave a public talk to research group and other invited guests. Met others in the lab. Was told that funding was a problem at the moment so my employment was contingent on a grant coming through. In the meantime I worked on a fellowship to get funding. During that time group leader told me he found enough money to hire me.
Interview Questions: Talk about my previous research. What was I currently working on?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to campus for a seminar lecture. After that I met with the PI and other lab members. I asked them if this lab is a good fit for me. Within the next week I received an offer.
Interview Questions: Questions about my PhD dissertation and even new emerging problems associated in the Northwestern lab.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Visited the site. Gave a scientific talk, which is standard for postdoc interview. Met with lab members, had nice a dinner. Talked about future project. And got job offer at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: Why you want to come to NU.

title: Kellogg Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: NU doesn't have a set list of questions from HR.  Expect it to be most commonly asked behavioral.  Values fit is very important.  Functional expertise.  Could be 1 round or 4 rounds depending on the department.
Interview Questions: could be anything behavioral.

title: Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very quick interview. You don't have to have any skills except people skills. Basically just want to know if you can come in when you're needed and that you are reliable. Helps if you've work in libraries before.
Interview Questions: What hours can you work?

title: Tier I Associate Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: First you submit a paper application which can be found on the IT website. Then you sit down with a few senior student consultants as well as the full-time manager for an in-person interview. After that, you are asked to work through a few mock-calls and problems that mimic what you might face out on the floor.
Interview Questions: What puzzles do you like to solve?

title: Mail Room Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. Just contacted them, and they got back to me the next day. Seems to be on a rolling basis and offers the job first come first serve. They told me to swing by one of the residential areas the next day, and after I got there, I was pretty much just given a run down of what will happen. There were a couple other prospects present as well.
Interview Questions: Are you committed?

title: AV Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: I don't remember having one. It is open to all students. You basically just have to show up and tell them about yourself. There aren't any typical interview questions. It is all over in a matter of minutes. You don't even need any relevant knowledge to get the job.
Interview Questions: Just background and experience. They need to know that you can lift over 30 pounds.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Presentation of thesis work, group and PI interview.
Interview Questions: So your joining our lab, right?

title: Research Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring/interview process was fast and courteous. I was contacted a week after the job closing date for an interview. A 1:1 interview was conducted within the next 3 days with the hiring manager. I was contacted within the next 10 days with an offer. The hiring manager was willing to hire me over "more qualified" candidates (meaning they had more experience in project coordination) so that I could gain valuable experience.

The background check process was interesting as both Human Resources and the hiring manager checked my references and the hiring manager required more references than usual.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you over candidates with project coordination experience?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was really relaxed. I met with a graduate student, who went through all the projects the lab was involved in. He was very open to questions and did a good job giving me a brief overview of the various projects.
I was told that I was accepted for the position within two weeks of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Contacted PI of interest directly due to my interest in their research
Got email response and scheduled in person interview within 2 weeks
Met with lab members first to discuss lab dynamics and research
Gave presentation of my past research
Met with PI to discuss possibilities within the lab
Heard back shortly afterwards offering me the position
Interview Questions:
Previous lab experience
Future aspirations

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions:
This was for an RA position with an Economics professor.
I had an initial phone interview with the professor's assistant, asking about my math and Stata background. I was also asked about my work preferences (do I like working alone, do I like being micromanaged etc.), and I was asked about my long-term career goals.
About 3 weeks later I was contacted for a Skype interview with the professor. The professor asked similar questions (research background, skills, math courses, etc.) but also some hard-hitting questions: "Why are you not applying to Econ PhD programs now?". 
I did not pass this round, but if you did, you were sent a problem set to do.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals? Grad school?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Really really really not bad at all. I came in, it lasted about thirty or so minutes and we basically chatted about my research, my experience, and everything else that comes with the role. I spent a good amount of time in the interview having a very very normal conversation.
Interview Questions: How many years have you been researching your subject?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Email for in-person interview, 2 interviews, 2nd interview rescheduled, started in a month
Interview Questions: Do you know how to use databases

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy.  They asked me a few questions about my educational background and then asked me my level of comfort in teaching one of them as an assistant.  Follow-up question about past teaching experience.
Interview Questions: How are your coding skills?

title: Medical Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Administration and staff are very conservative and averse to new ideas or newer leadership methods.  It appeared they they would rather fall behind peer institutions than make changes.  Met only briefly with staff and support staff during interview process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenging clinical case.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied to an ad I saw on a society website. My PI flew me in and put me up in a hotel by the university. The whole process took a day. I gave a talk at around 9:30 and then spoke with my boss about potential projects. I then had individual interviews with different members of the lab.
Interview Questions: How much do you expect to be paid?

title: Hispanic/Latino Student Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral based questions with emphasis on prior knowledge of the population of students.  Overall was a very fair interview, interviewer really wanted to get to know myself as an individual and what drew me to the job.
Interview Questions: What is the importance of Hispanic/Latino Student Affairs as a department.

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 2 Skype interviews within the period of a week.  I interview with my direct supervisors and had no contact with HR during the interview phase.  As such the questions were based on my experience in the field and my skillet.  There were none of the typical HR styled hypothetical questions.  It was a very straightforward interview process.  It was about 2 weeks from the last interview to me receiving the offer.  Work atmosphere is a good blend of private and public sector attitudes making it work with a good pace but with out the feeling of needless paper-pushing.
Interview Questions: I noticed on your academic transcript that you struggled in __________ classes.  Would you explain how you got these grades and how you would improve?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via email. Called for in person interview. Asked to do a research presentation. Did not hear anything for a month. Called them to follow up. A day later, I was offered the job. Negotiated the salary and joining date. All ended up in my favor and started the job a month later.
Interview Questions: Nothing technical.

title: Research Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, followed by face-to-face interview with Professor and various members of the research lab. Brief HR meeting to discuss benefits. Also had to give a presentation of past research projects.
Interview Questions: Describe your past research efforts.

title: Program Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had an excellent experience interviewing at Northwestern's Center for Talent and Development. They were very good at explaining the process and contacted me when they said they would through out the process. My first interview was over the phone, the second was with two department heads. All though, I did not make it to the third and final interview stage of another in person interview and Microsoft skills test, I will still keep applying at Northwestern based upon my positive interview experience and my friends who work there that all recommend it.  Based upon the amount of interviews I went on the process took a little over 5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Explain projects you have worked on simultaneously.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: External Applicant, phone screen interview with few questions, and in person formal panel interview.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this situation...

title: Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Austin, TX) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Office visit with the Austin Branch.  They asked basic interview questions such as values, work experience, etc.
Interview Questions: What are your core values

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Series of technical programming rounds. Got the offer through a friend. Met him at a conference. It was pretty easy to get in. Had a day long interview process but they pretty much knew me through a common thread so it turned out to be easy. However, it took almost 1 month to get an official confirmation. Northwestern Admin is just too slow in processing paperwork of new employees.
Interview Questions: Write a code to parse RDF data.

title: Research Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good.  I met with the lead investigator we talked about the vision of the lab I would be working. The lead investigator took me on a tour of the lab and I also meet with staff as well. The process overall was easy and I was able to get the job within two weeks of the interview.
Interview Questions: Do I like video games

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received a phone call to schedule an in-person interview with the supervisor. I arrived and the interview was a basic one-on-one behavioral interview. The hiring manager also asked questions regarding my previous work experience. Nothing was out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: How do you manage stress?

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed and hired within one week.
Interview Questions: None

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied for ESAM and there the interview are one on one with the professors. An entire day is devoted to meeting multiple faculty members and talking about their research. Lunch is with two current graduate students. They didn't call down multiple perspectives at the same time when I was interviewed. Now much has changed. It is still a lot of one on one attention with the faculty, but now there are more opportunities to meet and interact with the graduate students in the department.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: There are two components of the interview process: various activities completed in group, and a traditional 30 minute interivew. Overall, it is a fun process and the staff tries to make you as comfortable as possible. When I went through my group interview/activities, we collaborated well and I think that made the experience better.
Interview Questions: How I would engage residents on my floor if they seemed to not be interested and did not show up to events.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing was lengthy and redundant. Promises were made during the interview process that were outright lies.  Hiring took months which should have taken much less time.  Seems management has a hard time following up and following through on projects.  This could be a sign that staffing is spread too thin or manager simply is too busy with other matters.  Having worked here over a year, its clear manager is busy with personal projects.
Interview Questions: Most common but yet most difficult is the question where you're asked to describe your 3 weaknesses.  The answers are all probably the same also.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: standard graduate admission, submitted my past GPA and credentials from previous schools. Had my GRE and TOFEl and once i past the first round i had an interview with a faculty professor about my research interests.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous research and what i am interested in doing in grad schools and how my previous skills will apply

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: We met individually with three to six PIs for about 30 to 45 minutes each. The PIs mostly discussed their own work and the Northwestern environment, and asked a little about my own research experience and undergraduate education. They were also interested in me, personally, and my interests and career goals. and later went out on the town with current and prospective students. We also had a large dinner with current students and PIs, and attended a poster session put on by admitted first-years.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with direct supervisor and Chief of division- simple work history, skills and educational background. Why did I want to work there, etc. Took a few weeks to hear back from them. Got an offer that was low (47000) I asked for $50k. after a few days they accepted. Didn't get the final offer letter till about a month after my initial interview. Start date was about 3 weeks after that.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwestern?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Contacted PI through email and got an interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your previous job

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: A research proposal, and colloquia on site. During on site visit I was usually asked to explain the research I was doing and planning to do in future. Overall, pleasant experience
Interview Questions: I haven't had difficult or unexpected questions in general. Overall, I was only asked to tell about research and what I plan to do at the NU.

title: Research Technologist I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the professor running the lab I worked for regarding general questions I had about his field (I had met him during undergrad, though I attended a different school). It came around that I was job searching at the time and he happened to need a tech. From there it was a matter of waiting a couple months until his funds were available to be able to hire me.
Interview Questions: It was more of a general conversation.

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very disorganized.
Interview Questions: All the questions were not related to my work at all.

title: Research Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, followed by an in-person interview
Interview Questions: Lots of in depth questions on previous scientific experience, lab techniques, mouse surgery procedures, and overall lab management expertise.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: I got this interview through employee referral, the director knows my boss, my bossed recommended me.We made an appointment through e-mail, and had a talk for about 30 minutes. Two days later, I got interview from another director, both of them thought I am the one they are looking for. And gave me offer 5 days later.
Interview Questions: What is your expected salary?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: full day interview, starts with ice-breaking meeting with the boss, then scientific lecture, then one on one interviews with other lab members
Interview Questions: don't remember surprising questions - but I gave my talk maybe 10 times before

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
No serious interview was performed, it was scientific research position. so, they hired based on CV and letters.
Since quality and quantity of publication is the most important criteria. Have them ready.
Interview Questions: Only scientific questions.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Although the recruiter showed great interest in meeting with me and great enthusiasm in following up with me, she never called back when she said she would and when I would follow up, they would push the decision date back.  Recruiter did not answer calls or return messages.  After 30 days of trying to follow up, I gave up.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwestern?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Firstly, we just talk about why I want to apply the position.  Then I introduced my current projects carrying on at my current position.  Then the interviewer began to introduce the projects at his group.  Althougth he can not introduce too much information as some of them are confidential, he still described the purpose the research.  Finally the conversation went into personal communication, including my future career plan, the detail about the time I planned to serve at his group.
Interview Questions: What is your experience on experiement?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: As you know, people apply to graduate based on the admission requirement listed online. There is not too much to say about it.
Interview Questions: will ask you some former research area and some related question about the projects you have done in the past.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Midland, MI) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: one on one interview with the coordinator of the department, laid back environment, mostly personality interview questions with a couple of them targeting work experience and knowledge about the position
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I got an email to be notified that I was preselected for an interview. Then the interview included 5 person to person talks plus a 20 minutes presentation to a group of audience.  By the end I talked to PI for another 10 minutes. There are some breaks and I was offered for a free lunch.
Interview Questions: How did you find us?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online to the main jobs page. About two weeks later I got a short call setting up the interview. Went in for one interview. Heard back about two weeks later.

The interview was very standard. Describe a situation where you encountered conflict, worked with a team, had to solve a problem. What are your strengths and weaknesses? The interviewer was nervous.

This level position is mainly looking for a personality that is friendly and will fit in at the office.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: It's typical postdoc interview for PhDs. 45min presentation, and talking to lab members 1:1.
Interview Questions: Why did your PhD take 7 years?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: You will have the placement test. It does not terminate your admission if you fail all of them, but you will face some negative consequence from this when you are looking for your PhD advisor.
Interview Questions: In general, peopel suffered most from Physical Chemistry test.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions:
I contacted the department I wanted to work for.  I had one interview, and then 2 weeks later was called to come in for second interview. I came to interview and was surprised to be taken into a conference room where I interviewed with 5 men simultaneously.  One month later I did receive an offer, but I did not accept the offer because salary was 33% less than what I ended up taking in private sector.  I felt they were trying to take advantage of me.
I saw the office where I would have been working and it was crowded with many desks crammed together in a large room.
Interview Questions: They seemed to be trying to intimidate me.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: I knew the Professor who was getting the big grant and approached him directly.
Interview Questions: With a huge capital budget, where would you put your priorities while building this sector.

title: External Communications, With University Donors Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: This job involved external communications with university donors, basically pr to communicate university news in a way that will encourage donations.  Although the job requirements are pretty high, masters degree, several years experience, the job itself seemed to be pretty routine. They tell you the pay scale early in the interview process, which is very unusual, but the reason is that the pay is well below what you would expect to get given the qualifications they ask for. It only makes financial sense if you want to take advantage of their free employee tuition benefit, even that is questionable. I took myself out of the running pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: The questions I remember seemed to be geared towards evaluating whether you would fit in with the group.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview and preview weekend with faculty and current students
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a doctoral student?

title: Fund Raising Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: We briefly spoke on the telephone to ascertain whether it would make sense for me to come in for an interview. They liked the fact that I went to Northwestern, but the job itself paid a lot less than I expected for this type of job. Northwestern does have good benefits, but the value of the benefits was not enough to offset the salary differential from the market.
Interview Questions: It wasn't really a difficult interview, very preliminary.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern University (Evanston, IL) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was long and exhausting.  I went through two phone interviews with a recruiter, two phone interviews with the hiring manager , interview process with the hiring manager, and technical review with the developers on the team.
Interview Questions: What process did you go through to develop an application?
